Key Match Events: India won the 2nd Super Over to tie the match.
Axar Patel had an outstanding series with the ball.
Washington Sundar had a tidy series with the ball.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted big runs in the T20I series finale.
India's last T20I game before the World Cup.
India has not lost a bilateral men's T20I series at home in nearly five years.
Afghanistan's hopes rest on Rahmanullah Gurbaz's performance.
India may give Sanju Samson, Kuldeep Yadav, and Avesh Khan a chance to play.
Qais Ahmad may play for Afghanistan.
Post-Match Reflections: Afghanistan coach Jonathan Trott expressed that playing in India is tough but beneficial for their preparation for the T20 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium is known for high-scoring matches but can also favor spinners.
The weather forecast promises a clear, pleasant evening with temperatures in the mid-20s Celsius.
Mohammad Nabi is 67 runs away from becoming the second Afghanistan batter to score 2000 in T20Is.
Nabi and Najibullah Zadran are closing in on 100 sixes in T20Is.
Axar Patel needs one wicket to become the ninth India bowler to 50 in T20Is.
Rinku Singh, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Shivam Dube have three of the four best strike rates among India players with at least 200 T20I runs.
